ratings.comment: Professor will often obscurely mention a term or name during lecture without indicating its significance. Then it will appear on the midterm/final despite her not providing guided notes, lecture slides, or recorded lectures. Asides from the dense amount of readings, it is difficult to determine study terms from her discussion-based lecture plans.
Class is very interesting but Prof. Greene creates a horrible environment for learning.  White savior energy.  She will take points off papers because she doesn't agree with facts.  I'm not kidding.

The worst professor I have ever had.  The entire final grade was based on papers alone and unless you have the same extreme views you will not do well no matter how much time you put into the course.  She won't tell you what you got points off for even if you try speaking to her outside of the course.

Prof. Greene is well intentioned, Ill give her that but thats about all Ill give her. Her class is entirely Discussion based which is nice, but if you disagree with her views or narratives, get ready to hear about it and have her dismiss your comments. She talks over students and regularly corrects opinions which arent correctable.

White-savior energy for sure. She often completely dismisses comments and questions from students which can be incredibly frustrating. Feels like you're getting punished for participating in class because she basically says your response was incorrect, but if you don't participate she calls you out. Such an interesting class but bad prof.

Pretty interesting class with memoirs and sections of readings as assigned work, no real textbook. However, you will spend 40 bucks on buying memoirs. Greene is helpful, but appears to lack as much knowledge as some students in her classes. She likes to dominate discussions, and several times created a hostile environment towards her students.

Honestly I hated this class so much. She created a toxic environment. There were a few times when students, justifiably, got up and left in the middle of class after she spoke over them and disregarded everything they said. She had zero respect from the students after constantly disrespecting us.

I was really excited for this class, but it was such a disappointment. The other students knew more about black women's history than Prof Greene did, and there was no structure other than readings. Overall, she seemed like a white feminist teaching a class that would've been better taught by a black woman who better grasped the subject.

I really didn't like her. Her lectures were very boring and she would make students feel dumb for asking certain questions or not knowing an answer. Class is pointless but you have to go. All learning is done through reading outside of class.

She knows her stuff, and is very well versed and enthusiastic about it. But unless you are really into this stuff, it's pretty boring. Lectures are long and discussion based, but you don't learn much in class - but you have to go because she takes attendance and skipping class brings a knife to your grade. Lots of reading, learn by yourself.

Criminalizing Blackness was a great class if you are interested in issues of race and class in the U.S. This 2.5 hour seminar was 100% discussion based; there is no lecturing. Thus, you must do the readings and come to class ready to participate. Luckily the books she chooses are excellent. She's also a really nice lady.

This was for a topics seminar "Criminalizing Blackness: Race and Imprisonment in America." Dr. Greene is a great professor who knows her subject well and able to get students to think critically. A true scholar. She has high expectations for students and students should feel free to have high expectations for her.

Christina is amazing! I have taken like three of her classes and enjoyed all of them. She has a comprehensive understanding of the material and genuinely cares about her students. Watch out for the emphasis on "specific examples" because it is not as obvious as it sounds and she does not care to really expand on what that actually means. Love her!

"Gender & The Civil Rights Movement." This class was a lot of fun. You read a book per week and write 5-6 short book reviews. However, she is a TOUGH grader--but her critiques are useful. However she takes a while to grade papers and this could hinder your success. And she has a bad memory. But she FIERCE. I give her an AB

Great Professor. The books/novels are extremely interesting which makes the power lecture go by VERY fast. Class is just like a discussion, you talk about the reading/current events/etc. If you go to class and pay attention you will do well. Grades are based primarily on tests (which are based on the chats you have in lecture), essays, & attendance

She's a great professor and you should make sure to go to every lecture, as they are structured like discussions.  Make sure to be up on the readings, especially when she assigns novels (Pop quiz!).  The exams are easy if you've been to class.

Greene is very intelligent and she runs her sections as discussions.  she's always prepared and organized.  she gives essay tests with a review sheet that makes it very easy to prepare.  she's nice but sort of strict.  i loved her and took her classes 2 semesters in a row.
